definition[0]: the state of being equal, especially having equal pay, rights, or power
example[0]: Women workers are demanding parity with their male colleagues.
definition[1]: equality between the units of money from two different countries
definition[2]: the state of being the same as or equal to something else
example[1]: The country is hoping to move toward economic parity with  (=having the same wealth as) the rest of Europe.
example[2]: The price cuts bring the companyâ€™s prices into parity with those charged by AT&T.
definition[3]: a system for finding mistakes when information is sent from one computer or another
example[3]: Parity is used in many hardware applications where detecting an error is helpful.
definition[4]: when one unit of a currency or COMMODITY (=oil, metal, farm product etc) is worth the same as one unit of another
example[4]: Platinum prices could decline further, perhaps reaching parity with gold.
definition[5]: a figure representing what a particular currency is worth in another currency at a particular time
example[5]: One of the parities they will be checking is the dollar/yen rate.
